title: Groundhog Day
content: I can only imagine how wonderfully restorative it would be if I could always get home before dark… and be asleep through all the long hours of darkness. Then, by Imbolg, I would truly be ready for spring!
creator: Eliza Daley
sourceDescription: Insight and inspiration in turbulent times.

title: Restoring Hydrological Cycles as a Foundation for Water Resilience
content: By rebuilding functional hydrological cycles, societies can enhance the effectiveness of existing infrastructure, reduce vulnerability to climatic extremes, and regenerate the ecological foundations upon which water security ultimately depends.
creator: El Habib Ben Amara
sourceDescription: Insight and inspiration in turbulent times.

title: Do cows raze the land?
content: Unfortunately, the extremely simplistic narrative that plants are good and animals are bad has been given far too much prominence in the public debate. For sure, industrial livestock production has a number of serious flaws, but so does industrial crop production.
creator: Gunnar Rundgren
sourceDescription: Insight and inspiration in turbulent times.

title: How to Read the Signs of Collapse: Economic Stagnation, Resource Scarcity, and Europe’s Industrial Decline
content: Today, Nate is joined by Balázs Matics, the author of the popular Substack blog The Honest Sorcerer, to explore the systemic reasons behind civilization’s potential collapse, the importance of energy security, and the growing effects of geopolitical instability.
creator: Nate Hagens
sourceDescription: Insight and inspiration in turbulent times.

title: Anthropause: Excerpt
content: If the United States were to abandon that trajectory and take the concrete actions that are needed to achieve equitable ecological renewal, what elements of life in the present-day Global North would we necessarily, and gladly, leave behind?
creator: Stan Cox
sourceDescription: Insight and inspiration in turbulent times.

title: Self-Organization and the Promise of a Circular Amazonian Socio-Bioeconomy
content: Data-driven models of self-organization and critical collective phenomena in the natural world and within traditional Indigenous sociocultural structures, along with adaptive context-based frameworks, can help guide the transboundary development of a decentralized and circular socio-bioeconomy for the Amazon.
creator: Daniel Henryk Rasolt
sourceDescription: Insight and inspiration in turbulent times.
